title: Fix Add Manga dialog scrolling so action buttons are always reachable

requirements.text: Ensure the “Add Manga” dialog’s form content is scrollable within the dialog viewport so that the bottom action buttons (“Cancel” and “Add Manga”) are always reachable on all common screen sizes (including short laptop screens and mobile), without the dialog content overflowing off-screen.

quotes: i CLEARLY said to add the scrolling feature so that i can see the add manga button.

acceptanceCriteria: When the Add Manga dialog is open and the viewport height is small (e.g., ~700px or less), the dialog does not extend beyond the visible screen area.
The dialog body (fields such as Alternate Titles, Synopsis, Genres, Cover Images, Notes) can be scrolled to reach all inputs.

The “Cancel” and “Add Manga” buttons remain visible at the bottom of the dialog (sticky or fixed within the dialog) OR are always reachable via scrolling within the dialog, with no need to scroll the page behind the modal.
The scroll behavior works with mouse wheel/trackpad and touch scrolling on mobile.
No UI element overlays or blocks clicks on the “Cancel” and “Add Manga” buttons (buttons remain reliably clickable).

requirements.text: Add a minimal regression check for the Add Manga dialog layout to prevent future changes from reintroducing hidden/overflowing bottom actions (verify dialog max height constraint and internal scrolling behavior).

quotes: add the scrolling feature so that i can see the add manga button.

acceptanceCriteria: A documented manual test checklist exists in-repo (or equivalent lightweight test note) describing how to verify the Add Manga dialog scroll and action button accessibility at small viewport heights.
Running through the checklist confirms the “Add Manga” button can always be reached and clicked.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only UI components); implement fixes by adjusting usage/composition in app-level components such as frontend/src/components/manga/AddMangaDialog.tsx.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Do not add new backend features or modify backend schemas for this request.
Do not redesign unrelated pages or change manga CRUD behavior beyond fixing the dialog scrolling/accessibility issue.
